meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting the perception or awareness of the body and its movements.
meanings.sent1: The somatosensory experience of feeling a gentle touch on your skin can be very soothing.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the somatosensory responses of patients to understand their physical sensations better.
meanings.sent3: I tried to explain the concept of somatosensory perception to my cat, but she just purred and walked away.
meanings.sent4: Her somatosensory intuition was so sharp that she could almost predict the exact location of the mosquito on her arm.
meanings.sent5: The somatosensory memory of the warm sand between my toes on the beach will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the sensory systems that perceive and process bodily sensations.
meanings.sent1: The somatosensory nerves send signals to the brain about temperature and pressure.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are exploring new technologies to enhance somatosensory feedback in virtual reality.
meanings.sent3: The somatosensory overload from the crowded concert made him feel alive and energized.
meanings.sent4: Her somatosensory abilities were like having a built-in radar for detecting any changes in her environment.
meanings.sent5: The somatosensory exploration of different textures with fingertips can be a calming activity.
